meanings.definition: To sue someone in a court of law for damages.
meanings.sent1: She was sueding her neighbor for the damage to her car.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to start sueding the competitor for patent infringement.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character was sueding the villain for stealing his catchphrase.
meanings.sent4: The environmental group was sueding the government for neglecting wildlife protection.
meanings.sent5: The student was sueding the teacher for unfair grading practices.

meanings.definition: The act of using a machine to raise the nap on a fabric.
meanings.sent1: The sueding of the fabric gave it a softer feel.
meanings.sent2: The sueding process enhanced the texture of the material.
meanings.sent3: The sueding machine hummed softly in the corner of the workshop.
meanings.sent4: The sueding equipment made the fabric look more luxurious.
meanings.sent5: The sueding technique transformed the rough fabric into a cozy blanket.

meanings.definition: The process of treating leather to make it softer and more pliable.
meanings.sent1: The sueding of the leather jacket made it more comfortable to wear.
meanings.sent2: The sueding method improved the quality of the leather goods.
meanings.sent3: The sueding of the leather boots made them as soft as clouds.
meanings.sent4: The sueding process turned the stiff leather into a supple material.
meanings.sent5: The sueding treatment gave the leather a luxurious finish.
